==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|切|符}}

===Etymology===
From {{m|ja|切る|sc=Jpan}} (''kiru'', "cut," "slice," "carve") + {{m|ja|符|sc=Jpan}} (''fu'', "tally split in half used for identification")

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|きっぷ}}

# a [[ticket]] used for public transport
# a [[ticket]] for [[speeding]]

Used normally only by the elderly to refer to plane tickets. [[チケット]] is more commonly used in this case.

====Derived terms====
{{top2}}
* {{l|ja|切符切り}} (''kippukiri''): ticket punch, ticket puncher
* {{l|ja|切符売り}} (''kippuuri''): ticket seller
* {{l|ja|切符売り場}}, {{l|ja|切符売場}} (''kippu uriba''): ticket window, box office, ticket
* {{l|ja|切符をとる}}, {{l|ja|切符を取る}} (''kippu o toru''): buy an advance sales ticket
* {{l|ja|切符を切る}} (''kippu o kiru''): rip off a coupon, punch a ticket
* {{l|ja|切符を改める}} (''kippu o aratameru''): examine tickets
* {{l|ja|赤切符}} (''akakippu''): third-class ticket
{{mid2}}
* {{l|ja|半切符}} (''hankippu''): half-price ticket
* {{l|ja|通し切符}} (''tōshikippu''): through ticket
* {{l|ja|往復切符}} (''ōfuku kippu''): round-trip ticket, return ticket
* {{l|ja|片道切符}} (''katamichi kippu''): one-way ticket
* {{l|ja|点数切符}} (''tensū kippu''): ration-point coupon
* {{l|ja|連絡切符}} (''renraku kippu''): connection ticket, interline ticket
* {{l|ja|割引切符}} (''waribiki kippu''): reduced fare ticket
{{bottom}}
